item.title: Beyond Moore's Law
item.description: Back in the 60’s, Intel co-founder Gordon Moore famously predicted that the number of transistors we can fit on a computer chip will double about every two years, with the implication that the speed of computers will grow just as fast. Although it was just an empirical observation at the time, it held true for the next several decades as computers went from slow behemoths to the ubiquitous, powerful devices they are today.
